article.title: In Photos: An Isla Vista Summer 2017
article.description: In Isla Vista, summertime means sitting on rooftops or on the beach to watch the sunset, sailing to the Channel Islands, all while a wildfire scorches through thousands of acres in Santa Barbara Count...
article.content:
In Isla Vista, summertime means sitting on rooftops or on the beach to watch the sunset, sailing to the Channel Islands, all while a wildfire scorches through thousands of acres in Santa Barbara County.

Photos by Daily Nexus photographers

A pod of dolphins glides through the water by the Santa Barbara Channel Islands. Anthony Lai/Daily Nexus

Camp Kesem counselors play a game of egg roulette, risking having a raw egg cracked over their head. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Campers turn their counselors into “human sundaes” during Messy Day at Camp Kesem. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Camp Kesem campers pose with counselor king “Tukka.” Campers and counselors all had assigned “camp names” in place of their real ones. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Firefighters on a break watch smoke billow from the Whittier fire as the sun goes down. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Flames from the Whittier fire edge toward Highway 154. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Pictured here is Anacapa Island on a sunny day. Anthony Lai/Daily Nexus

The sun sets over Del Playa Drive on a Friday evening. Michelle Sharp/Daily Nexus

Print

A cool team of photographers who preserves the visual memory of UCSB and Isla Vista.

related.title: In Photos: Halloween festivities in Isla Vista washed away by rain
related.description: On Friday, any and all anticipation and fears of an Isla Vista Halloween of unprecedented rambunctiousness were washed away by heavy rain. One more day of Halloween weekend to go. Photo Credits: Anna ...
related.content:
On Friday, any and all anticipation and fears of an Isla Vista Halloween of unprecedented rambunctiousness were washed away by heavy rain.

One more day of Halloween weekend to go.

Photo Credits: Anna Kodelashvili, Will Tran

The torrential downpour of rain caught Halloween revelers with their pants down–in the case of this man, literally. Photo by Anna Kodelashvili

A man carries a hamper full of clothes (foreground) out of a beached sailboat on the shores of Isla Vista. Photo by Will Tran

Big branches of a tree fell near the restaurants of Pita Pit and Naan Stop between Trigo and Seville roads on Embarcadero del Mar. Photo by Anna Kodelashvili

A Bane casually strolls past a police barricade, apparently thirsty for some coke. Photo by Anna Kodelashvili

First aid stations were set up in Isla Vista to treat potential patients. Photo by Will Tran

There were few persons on the streets during the downpour on Friday. Del Playa Drive was so empty that police officers closed up the barricades blocking the street, allowing traffic to flow on the drive. Photo by Will Tran

related.title: In Photos: Khalid at the Hub
related.description: Finally making his way up to Santa Barbara, neo-soul, pop-influenced singer Khalid performed his long-awaited set in the Hub this past Saturday.
related.content:
Finally making his way up to Santa Barbara, neo-soul, pop-influenced singer Khalid performed his long-awaited set in the Hub this past Saturday. As iPhone-clad hands went up to wave along to the songs and film Snapchat stories, excitement radiated from the stage to the crowd. It is safe to say that the native Texan was well received on the shores of UCSB and will be remembered as one of the most anticipated shows in recent Program Board history.

Photos by Jenny Luo

related.title: IN PHOTOS: UCSB eliminated from the Big West Semis
related.description: On Wednesday, the UCSB men’s soccer squad competed against a slumping UC Irvine squad–whom they beat earlier this season–to advance past the Big West semifinals. The Anteaters denied...
related.content:
On Wednesday, the UCSB men’s soccer squad competed against a slumping UC Irvine squad–whom they beat earlier this season–to advance past the Big West semifinals. The Anteaters denied them passage into the Big West finals, defeating the Gauchos 3-2 to gain a much-needed confidence boost.

The Gauchos now wait to see if they will continue their season into the NCAA tournament. The NCAA Selection Committee will put together the 48-team field next week.

Photos by Eric Swenson, Kenneth Song

Players gather together before the playing of the National Anthem. (Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus)

UCSB players celebrate after Drew Murphy scored in the first 54 seconds of the match. (Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus)

Defender Dylan Murphy (23) tries to kick the ball away from midfielder Gor Kirakosyan during the first half of the match. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Anteaters and Gauchos battle for the ball. (Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus)

UC Irvine’s Michael Sperber (32) and UCSB’s Ismaila Jome tumble into the grass during the second half of the match. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Nick DePuy (6, far left) kneels on the grass in disbelief after he missed the goal on a 1v1 opportunity. Conversely, UCI defender Matthew Tilley (4) expresses his relief to his teammate Mitchell Alvarez (9). (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Defender Jack Birkenbeuel (left) and Nick DePuy struggle for the ball during the first half of the match. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

About 1900 people attended the UCSB-UC Irvine matchup on Wednesday. (Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus)

UCSB and UCI players alike prepare for a UCSB penalty kick during the second half of the match. (Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus)

UC Irvine goalkeeper Michael Breslin catches the ball away from UCSB’s Dugan Zier. Breslin had five saves in the match. (Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus)

A UCSB player struggles to digest defeat at the hands of the Anteaters, who are seen celebrating their triumph in the background. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)
